code: const diseaseDatabase={melanoma:{disease:"Melanoma",description:"Melanoma is a serious form of skin cancer that develops in melanocytes, the cells that produce melanin pigment. It often appears as a dark, irregularly-shaped mole and can spread rapidly to other parts of the body if not detected early.",precautions:"Avoid excessive sun exposure, especially between 10 AM and 4 PM. Always wear broad-spectrum sunscreen with SPF 30 or higher. Wear protective clothing including wide-brimmed hats and long sleeves. Perform regular self-examinations using the ABCDE rule (Asymmetry, Border, Color, Diameter, Evolving).",cure:"Treatment depends on the stage and includes surgical excision of the melanoma with margins of healthy tissue. Advanced cases may require immunotherapy, targeted therapy, chemotherapy, or radiation therapy."},eczema:{disease:"Eczema (Atopic Dermatitis)",description:"Eczema is a chronic inflammatory skin condition that causes dry, itchy, red, and inflamed patches of skin.",precautions:"Keep skin well-moisturized. Use mild soaps. Wear breathable fabrics. Avoid triggers.",cure:"Topical corticosteroids/calcineurin inhibitors; moisturizers; phototherapy; biologics for severe cases."},psoriasis:{disease:"Psoriasis",description:"Chronic autoimmune condition causing thick, scaly red patches with silvery scales.",precautions:"Moisturize; avoid injuries/sunburns; reduce stress; limit alcohol; quit smoking.",cure:"Topicals (steroids, vitamin D analogs), phototherapy, systemic meds or biologics."},acne:{disease:"Acne Vulgaris",description:"Common skin condition with clogged pores, pimples, blackheads and sometimes cysts.",precautions:"Gentle cleansing; avoid picking; non-comedogenic products; sunscreen.",cure:"Benzoyl peroxide, salicylic acid, retinoids, antibiotics; isotretinoin for severe."},rosacea:{disease:"Rosacea",description:"Chronic inflammatory facial redness with bumps/pimples.",precautions:"Avoid triggers; SPF 30+; gentle skincare.",cure:"Topical metronidazole/azelaic/ivermectin; oral doxycycline; lasers for vessels."},"basal cell carcinoma":{disease:"Basal Cell Carcinoma (BCC)",description:"Most common skin cancer; pearly bump or flat scar-like lesion.",precautions:"Strong sun protection; shade; protective clothing; avoid tanning beds.",cure:"Surgical excision or Mohs; alternatives include ED&C, cryo, topical 5-FU/imiquimod, radiation."},"normal skin":{disease:"Normal Healthy Skin",description:"No disease detected by the tool.",precautions:"Maintain healthy skincare & daily SPF.",cure:"No treatment necessary."}};export default diseaseDatabase;
